intro: Psychotria elliptica, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia, Peru, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers. It is often found in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Psychotria elliptica is also noted for its use in traditional medicine and its ecological importance in its native habitats.
